Hosts are fantastic, gracious with solid communication. I appreciate that since travel is, well travel.
They have an incredibly unique home. I was excited to see it as the trip was upcoming. It’s a mix of gorgeous century old tiles and arches along with newer remodeling. I am not even scratching the surface on all of the neat things about this place.
Reading reviews prior to coming I brought my professional camera and had fun on my down time taking pictures of the house, the stars and all the new ducklings at the nearby park.
My favorite place, is the upstairs tiled shower because you can sing so acoustically. The rain shower is great modern touch and wonderful.
I was primarily upstairs, here for work and wasn’t in all of the house but knew full well this is a great place to bring family and friends, big yard, back patio, grill etc!
Getting in late on an extended stay, it was very nice to have things available until I could get sorted.
Beautiful people, David and Oriana.
Recommend!

If there were places like this in every town, I’d never stay in a hotel again. I’m a realtor and I intentionally travel to unique places to share the experience and encourage others to as well. This one takes the cake! It’s bursting with history and mystery but cozy and charming and boasts every modern amenity. The hosts are wonderful people. Great communication. The property is in a perfect location. We Doordashed food and craft coffees from a number of wonderful options because we were so enjoying the space. We grilled out on the nice new deck. We enjoyed the fireplace each evening. The dogs had plenty of safe space to play. We did take them to the dog park and walked around the beautiful pond at Wintersmith. I’d encourage you to do so too or walk the neighborhood at least.
If I could give this place 10 stars, I would. If you’re thinking for one minute about booking a stay here, the thinking is over! Do it!
If you’re looking for stuff to do, check out nearby Sulphur, Davis or Pauls Valley, OK. Many Indian history experiences, 77’ waterfall at Turner Falls, zip lines, Arbuckle drive through wilderness a great state park lake, etc. So much to do and see!

Bring doorknob covers; outlet covers already on most or all outlets. Nice playset in the backyard our toddler enjoyed!
We stayed Saturday night through Wednesday night and we only encountered an overnight train after 10:45 PM on Wednesday night. Earliest train was after 6:00 AM. We all slept great; kid slept through the one overnight train and I just woke briefly. Neighborhood looks a little rough, but we never had an issue with crime this year or last.
The heat works fantastically as does the water heater. Plentiful spare linens/blankets, towels/washcloths. Dish soap, two dishwasher packets (save one for checkout), roll of paper towels included. I simply cannot say enough good about this place!
If you’re looking for a break from the daily grind, this is definitely it! You will more than likely have cell service, but if you’re on your phone for unnecessary reasons, you’re missing out on the fun! There are more ponds than you can fish in a week, endless opportunities to see wildlife, and no reason to not explore the great outdoors.
It rained every day of our four day stay, but regardless of that, we all had the best vacation ever! I’ve never seen our three boys so happy!
We took our four wheeler and trail bikes and rode different trails everyday, but still didn’t see all of the property. I spent mornings on the front or back porch, enjoying the peace and quiet.
There’s honestly just too much to list!
Ron is an absolutely fantastic host! Such a great spirit, amazingly helpful and thoughtful, and so easy to work with!
We can’t wait for the many future trips we plan on making back to this amazing property!

The perfect getaway, close enough to the city but far enough that you can’t hear the traffic. Dos Equis Ranch was exactly as we had hoped. Thankfully we had access to an ATV so exploring the vast acreage was part of the adventure. At night, the only thing louder than our crackling fire was the sound of the frogs.
The cabin is equipped with everything you will need, including a full kitchen, washer and dryer, and hot shower. For those that need to stay connected, your phones will likely get full service out here like ours did. But if you’re on your phone, you’re missing the point. Cabin life is the good life.
Ron and his family are welcoming and there to help if you need them. If you get a chance, as him about the work he did on the land. The man has lived two lifetimes and he’s not close to done. Can’t wait to get back out there and continue our conversation.
